topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/558b59746368722d890018b7#post_558b59746368722d890018b7
*Throws a smoke bomb on the ground and runs away!*

Joking aside trying to remember what it was like is like trying to grasp smoke with your hands.  I still remember a fair portion, but trying to remember distinctly what it was like is really hard to do.

From my perspective what it was like was it felt like getting every piece of you torn to shreds then reassembled then seeing some sort of greeting pavilion and looking at someone with hazy eyes like your eyesight is trying to adjust then talking to someone that I feel like I should know and remember telling me "everything's going to be okay" and *WAM!* gasping for breath alive again.

I know I know that person cause I know I've seen them from somewhere, but it's like trying to remember the face of someone you haven't seen in years.

If you ever wonder what being dead feels like from the initial moments the first thoughts are "OH SHIT!" and then "Am I fucking high?!" then "What the fuck is going on?"  "Who the hell are you?"  "Why the hell don't I remember you?  I should remember you!"
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
